subject: Career
title: The Contrast Effect Between Candidates
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on The Contrast Effect Between Candidates.

hook.text: A mediocre candidate after three terrible ones looks brilliant. Context distorts judgment.

buildup.text: The contrast effect means we judge things relative to what came before, not on absolute merit.

discovery.text: Your interview slot matters more than you think. After a strong candidate, you look weaker.

twist.text: You can't control your slot, but you can control your anchor â€” start with your strongest story.

climax.text: Scorecards help interviewers evaluate against the role, not against the last person.

punchline.text: You're not competing with candidates. You're competing with their memory.

quiz.question: What is the contrast effect in interviewing?
options: Judging candidates relative to who came before
